column1: Something I’m thankful for this year? Florida sunshine in November!😎  Consider celebrating Turkey Day outdoors this year to slow the spread of COVID-19 – and check out more common-sense guidelines below to keep your loved ones safe this Thanksgiving🦃   https://t.co/0hu7POxvQf

BREAKING: @TGHCares will be one of first 5 Florida hospitals to receive COVID-19 vaccine once available. This is good news for Tampa Bay – and all the more reason to stay vigilant social distance and mask up to slow the rise of cases. We can do this Pinellas! https://t.co/1fERe7eG4Z

The mayors are right what we are doing is not working as #COVID cases across state are on the rise. Testing contact tracing and a mask mandate are necessary to save lives until vaccines are distributed. https://t.co/FksMAlHMHQ

Pinellas families and our economy can’t afford to wait any longer for COVID relief. Took to House Floor today calling on Congress to rise to the occasion put differences aside and pass relief that will help folks in need. Let’s get it done. https://t.co/PyxQ1CXZ2M

PINELLAS: Financial assistance is available thru the CARES Act for individuals & #smallbiz who need help covering rent or other expenses due to COVID-19.  The deadline for applications is Friday Nov. 13 – get started at https://t.co/G07RgVrhy7.

Staff at Ivy Ridge Memory Care are finding innovative ways to keep patients connected to loved ones during COVID-19. Zoom calls window visits & even a ‘cuddle curtain’ for hugs w/ family are helping bring families together during the holidays - even from 6 feet apart. https://t.co/ed8g3DnQq1
Today is the last day to cast your vote in the 2020 General Election. Before you head out be sure to confirm your polling location - some may have changed due to COVID-19.  https://t.co/Gj8KnVxADV

Bumped into some caregivers from Seniors Helping Seniors in Clearwater! These good people of all ages and backgrounds are helping our elderly residents combat the fear and isolation caused by COVID-19 - I’ll keep fighting to get you the PPE testing and funding you need! https://t.co/uIEApNNT9v

If you’re behind on rent or are threatened with eviction you have options. The Pinellas Eviction Diversion Program offers free legal help and landlord mediation to Pinellas residents facing financial difficulties as a result of COVID-19. Call (727) 582 -7475 to learn more.

Yesterday the US recorded the highest daily number of COVID-19 cases since July and the second highest since this crisis began. Read my statement below on the 3rd nationwide spike of the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/ZLNRPrQe0e

Meet Michelle owner of St. Pete's Your CBD Store. When COVID-19 caused sales to drop Michelle applied for #PPP funds that helped save the jobs of her staff. I’ll keep fighting to help entrepreneurs like Michelle - and her four-legged business partner Little Dipper too! https://t.co/hAK7kzzyJl

For Veterans suffering from PTSD depression & other invisible wounds of war the isolation and stress caused by COVID-19 been particularly painful. Veterans Counseling Veterans is working to keep Veterans connected to the support they need to continue on their road to recovery. https://t.co/ISFfA8sdPw

After COVID-19 hit Chef Tony & Claudia started using iPads instead of menus to make ordering safer at their Indian Rocks Beach restaurant Casa Italia. These safety measures are important but expensive – we must pass add'l relief to help #smallbiz keep their customers safe! https://t.co/pSKQXdBgev

When COVID-19 forced their sons to come home from college Betty & Mike of Indian Rocks Beach put them to work in their new restaurant Groupers. The economic crisis is threatening this promising #smallbiz – I'm working to pass more PPP funding to help #MainStreet recover! https://t.co/IoLovBGhkO
Attention Pinellas!   If you’re having trouble paying rent due to the COVID-19 crisis you may qualify for eviction protection. #KnowYourRights  Visit https://t.co/YjB58rXoV2 to learn more.

Dropped by Zen Massage & Yoga in Indian Rocks Beach - owner Hope says business has slowed due to COVID-19 but federal assistance helped her keep her doors open & staff employed. I’ll keep fighting for Hope to pass additional relief to protect Pinellas small businesses! https://t.co/7tXBdKDfGQ

Due to COVID-19 more Pinellas families are at risk of eviction and homelessness than ever before. The staff at @IncBoley are stepping up to help even while facing budget shortfalls as a result of this crisis. Congress must pass more relief to protect these essential services! https://t.co/eld4EDikNj

Thank you to the healthcare workers who joined us today from the front-lines of the COVID-19 crisis. Continuing the fight in Congress to get our Pinellas healthcare heroes the PPE and testing supplies they need to keep us safe!  https://t.co/xKRqv9Q1eZ

State Theatre is a piece of St. Pete history - & thanks to new renovations it’s now part of its future too! I support #SaveOurStages Act to stop COVID-19 from hurting ventures like Floridian Social Club that preserve our history create jobs and revive our live music industry! https://t.co/BSCKasyrVy

Had a great socially distanced conversation with my Largo neighbors while delivering masks to Elmcroft Senior Living. Our seniors and elder care workers are bearing the brunt of this crisis - it’s up to us to continue taking COVID-19 seriously and take measures to keep cases low! https://t.co/xTRc3WMwfu

Today the President tweeted that COVID relief talks would not resume until AFTER the election. Aid is needed NOW! Millions of Americans are in need — working families children and small biz owners. https://t.co/Yl092UqLqU

The COVID-19 pandemic is hurting venues like @RuthEckerdHall and the performers arts educators and staff that make their living there. I’m proud to support the #SaveOurStages Act to help cultural institutions like this one keep the lights on throughout this crisis! https://t.co/ms7wIzgTIT

When the time comes the U.S. must be prepared to rapidly distribute a #COVID19 vaccine to fight the pandemic & save lives. Introduced legislation with @repmarkpocan & @RepLBR to make sure we have all the tools necessary to deliver the vaccine as soon as possible! https://t.co/utN0qQ0Bm1

Our thoughts and prayers are with the President the First Lady and their staff. This virus is incredibly transferable no one is exempt. Until there’s a vaccine our best defense is to continue to mask up social distance and follow @CDCgov guidelines.

Thanks to the diligence of the people of Florida COVID-19 cases have declined significantly – but now’s not the time to let our guard down! Let’s protect our seniors essential workers and those with pre-existing conditions by continuing to #MaskUp! 😷 https://t.co/QSMScznnlt

When COVID-19 forced @TequilasClearw to close its doors owner Elizabeth switched to online orders and saved the jobs of all her employees. Thanks to Elizabeth and her amazing staff for showing me around - keep up the good work! https://t.co/Gs8E4WG2si

19 years ago the 9/11 terrorist attacks robbed our country of nearly 3000 lives including 412 first responders lost in the line of duty.  Today we honor our sacrifice and extend our gratitude to all first responders on the front line of the fight against COVID-19. #PatriotDay https://t.co/cc60ZSjLkH

5 de Mayo Bakery has been serving the people of Clearwater for over 15 years. While the economic impacts of COVID-19 have hit small businesses the hardest loyal customers have kept this family business going strong. Proud to #ShopSmall and support our local business owners! https://t.co/aMQXp5xn7R

Hurricane season is upon us but it’s not too late to make a plan. @PinellasEM has published their 2020 Hurricane Guide with updated guidelines addressing COVID-19 health concerns. Download yours today: https://t.co/L89uZbS67F

Pinellas #SmallBiz Pinellas CARES is expanding grants to businesses forced to shut down due to COVID-19 restrictions. If your business makes less than $3 million in annual revenue you may be eligible for up to $10000 in assistance. Apply today 👉 https://t.co/BY48WFgayl

We’re six months into the pandemic w/ flu season on the horizon & the US & Florida are STILL falling short on #Coronavirus testing. Introduced legislation to allow non-traditional testing labs like veterinarian & university labs join the fight to protect the public’s health! https://t.co/YYZTwCKjYw

Bob Heilman’s Beachcomber is a Clearwater Beach institution. When COVID-19 threatened to close its doors our team helped owner Sheri navigate the SBA loan process so she could keep her people employed & business running. Thanks for reaching out Sheri - glad we could help! https://t.co/mFAa7I3YmO

#SmallBiz reopening safely in Gulfport – doing it right! But COVID19 losses are hitting small cities like Gulfport hardest. #HeroesAct would allocate estimated $6.1 million relief to Gulfport to retain staff & provide essential services. Senate must act KEY to economic recovery! https://t.co/D0Hc2xDHR7

The impacts of COVID-19 and natural disasters like Hurricane Laura have left our hospitals and first responders in dire need of blood and plasma donations. Thanks to the good people at @My1Blood for getting help to those in need! https://t.co/ZePeyiZcbm

Mayors & city governments are stepping up to keep us safe during #COVID19. Thanks to @CityOfLargo Mayor Woody Brown for meeting w/ me as we work to protect Largo residents – we must pass #HeroesAct relief funding for cities to keep workers employed & provide life-saving services! https://t.co/FTdf2KqphL

Thanks @TB_Times for lifting the voices of our Tampa Bay postal workers. We must keep the pressure on the Senate to pass $25 billion included in #HeroesAct for @USPS to protect mail voting and support our postal workers as they work through the COVID-19 crisis. #DontMessWithUSPS! https://t.co/hTUnTpcHub

Due to #COVID19 Lorilyn from St. Pete has relied on @USPS to deliver her medications and food so that she doesn’t have to go outside. Without the #USPS Lorilyn worries that she’ll have to risk her health to get critical supplies or go without #SaveUSPS https://t.co/bibUY3aZyZ

While this is a temporary victory thanks to the public outcry we still need to do more to #SaveUSPS. This includes requiring the postal service to maintain the same level of service providing $25 billion to help them recover from COVID-related losses.

Iraq War Vet Mike Delancey worked w/ his hometown of Pinellas Park to create Wounded Warriors Abilities Ranch as an accessible space for Veterans & families to enjoy. It’s crucial we pass #HeroesAct to fund states & cities during #COVID19 & protect public facilities like these! https://t.co/KkyeS7r6q0

Heads up St. Pete! Brick-and-mortar AND home-based small businesses impacted by COVID-19 can still apply for emergency grants through the @StPeteFL Fighting Chance Fund. Applications close on Friday August 14th – click the link below to apply!  https://t.co/ujDrbWP8nU

Pinellas non-profits: @PinellasCF is accepting applications for CARES Act funding for community organizations providing services to those in need as a result of COVID-19. If your organization has been impacted by this crisis apply below. https://t.co/0yuDzrejJ0

Cuts by the Trump Administration to @USPS during COVID-19 have slowed delivery of medication & other essentials. Also putting the votes of millions of Floridians at risk. COVID-19 relief MUST fully fund our postal service so mail can be delivered on time rain or shine! https://t.co/WNDUWOuoxE
Good work Pinellas! By wearing masks and social distancing our rate of new COVID-19 cases has dropped significantly. Let’s keep it up!  https://t.co/wxRfom8Y1A

To combat COVID and move our nation forward families need a solution to safe and affordable child care. Proud to support legislation that puts Pinellas families workers and children first! #SaveChildCare https://t.co/jSIIbFRwok https://t.co/3kDCxyQWzY
COVID-19 TESTING UPDATE: New testing site opened in South St. Pete at Pinellas Community Church. Contact 833-697-4352 to make an appointment and get tested! https://t.co/cotjIeE7mM

ATTN: Pinellas residents who’ve lost their jobs or income and have less than $10000 in assets: You can receive up to $5000 to help with food rent and unpaid bills. Text COVIDCARES to 898211 to start your application.   https://t.co/WGnIi7TFUI

Joining @RepShalala and FL delegation from both sides of the aisle and chambers of Congress calling upon @HHSGov to send badly-needed life-saving COVID-19 drugs to Florida. Hospitals are running out and lives are at stake – we need shipments NOW. https://t.co/KdhlIudXq2

As an Honor and Civility Caucus Co-Chair w/ @RepMikeJohnson and @RepCleaver  we introduced legislation marking July 12 as a National Day of Civility. Now more than ever we must treat others with respect and unify as a country to defeat coronavirus and move forward together! https://t.co/1IjgIiER7t

From increased funds for research into a #COVID vaccine to supporting programs for vulnerable underserved communities the FY 2021 Labor-HHS-Education @AppropsDems bill makes the investments needed to give every person a better chance at a better life. https://t.co/ELzZy9bPDk https://t.co/9akeHLb5IX

If you’ve recovered from COVID-19 your plasma donation could mean the difference between life and death for others struggling with the virus. To learn how and where to donate click the link below.   https://t.co/hyCslrfAO7
Thank you @NYGovCuomo and the great people of New York for answering our call for help with kindness and generosity as our state continues to battle #COVID19. 🙏 https://t.co/ys7eKLJhmo
Joining @MSNBC’s Joy Reid on #AMJoy at 11:30am to discuss #COVID19 and what State needs to do to keep Floridians safe! https://t.co/yhrim6zn7Y
Grateful to @CDCDirector Redfield @SeemaCMS and Dr. Deborah Birx for swiftly answering FL Democratic delegation's call for an emergency distribution of lifesaving COVID-19 treatment Remdesivir.
$400000 in #CARESAct funding on its way to @TampaBayRPC to help us respond to the COVID-19 pandemic and provide an economic roadmap for the path forward! https://t.co/94Tx9AZUKE

Florida has run out of the critical drug Remdesivir needed to treat #COVID19 patients. Florida Democratic Delegation calling on HHS Secretary to expedite supplies needed to save lives and protect Floridians.  https://t.co/SM3Od1yy7l @RepHastingsFL @RepDWStweets https://t.co/armeSN3GCY

TONIGHT: Pinellas Seniors I’ll be hosting a live #COVID19 telephone town hall with local leaders at 6:00pm to hear from you and share information and important resources.  🔊 Listen in at https://t.co/vzPwvZ7gGM  📞 Call to ask a question at 855-531-1062 https://t.co/80bUh8nG2C

Eviction moratorium was extended to Aug. 1st last night by Gov. DeSantis. We need to keep extending the moratorium while #COVID19 is spiking and at least until everyone has access to unemployment benefits so they can pay their rent. https://t.co/nF9AlYagiZ
Tune in tonight 6pm @CNN with host @AnaCabrera where we discuss Florida’s rising #COVID cases and the actions I’m calling for to keep Floridians safe. https://t.co/16OQoCulE3

FL Surgeon General has already advised masks be worn in public at all times as #COVID19 cases rise. Thankful that Pinellas’ county-wide mask order starts today but still need action from DeSantis’ administration to protect ALL Floridians and end community spread! #MaskUpFlorida https://t.co/ewzFBilU0K
LIVE: Joining @LULAC and @LulacFl to discuss the impact of the COVID-19 health and economic crises on Florida's Hispanic community 👇  https://t.co/wHataic67F

.@IRSnews Economic Impact Payments shouldn't be turned over to any entity other than recipient. It’s your money & doesn’t count as income. There are no restrictions to receiving even if you receive assistance from Medicare/Medicaid. https://t.co/aJ5vYW9lWN #COVIDreliefIRS

WATCH: Speaking with @BN9's @RICKELMHORST on importance of comprehensive weekly COVID-19 testing in Florida nursing homes. Accurate data is CRITICAL to stopping deadly outbreaks before they begin.  📺https://t.co/xvPS3CnhEg

At today’s virtual @HouseScience Committee hearing learning from experts about how fire departments across the country require additional funds to respond to COVID-19. We need passage of the HEROES Act immediately to bring relief to our first responders. https://t.co/H4Y2UdF2HV

Almost $7 MILLION in #CARESAct funding for Pinellas residents experiencing or at risk of experiencing homelessness! Cutting down on COVID-19 transmission by helping folks find housing and keeping folks in their homes! https://t.co/KvbUXfJhvX

Almost $7 MILLION in #CARESAct funding for Pinellas residents experiencing or at risk of experiencing homelessness! Cutting down on COVID-19 transmission by helping folks find housing and keeping folks in their homes! https://t.co/KvbUXfJhvX

Oceans power our economy and define our way of life in Pinellas. But the benefits don’t stop there. As we fight #COVID19 the diversity of species found in our oceans offers great promise for products to combat illness and improve our quality of life. #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/OyHoKJh2b3

Seniors living in nursing homes and assisted living facilities have been hit hard by #COVID19. Sent letter calling on Gov DeSantis calling for a robust testing plan to safeguard the health of elder folks and their caregivers. https://t.co/lTLtjQMLWi https://t.co/sjKwcG16FH
Delivering masks to Pinellas residents in need at @SVdP_SP. #COVID19 is still with us - wearing a mask protects each other slows the spread and saves lives! https://t.co/09VwEHTvrB

When #COVID19 hit @BigStormBrewing stepped up #ForThePeople to manufacture desperately needed hand sanitizer. The move helped keep their staff employed and our community safer -- Cheers! https://t.co/6Uec9HhzA2

Privileged to help distribute food to my South St. Pete neighbors who’ve had their income impacted as a result of #COVID19. Thanks to the good people at Atwaters BBQ giving back to their neighbors since this crisis began – #BlackOwnedBusiness & pillar of our community! https://t.co/K5bXEaT37b

Sheldon is a construction worker in St. Pete. His landlord threatened to ignore moratorium on evictions & he has been forced to work through the pandemic. With less work as result of #COVID19 he’s has to spend every dime he makes just to cover rent. #FloridaEvictionStories https://t.co/vqWBV82fCW https://t.co/WlmkVSL37N

Jennifer of St. Pete hasn’t received unemployment benefits since she lost her job during #COVID19 and is now three months behind on rent. While her landlord has worked with so far she’s worried if she doesn’t receive benefits soon she’ll lose her home. #FloridaEvictionStories https://t.co/GGi2lc8Vmn

Leon of St. Pete lost his job during the #COVID19 crisis and still hasn’t received any unemployment benefits. While the eviction moratorium has stopped his landlord from throwing him onto the street he’s warned him he’ll evict Leon once it’s lifted. #FloridaEvictionStories

Right call @GovRonDeSantis! Thank you for extending the eviction moratorium to July 1st - a necessary measure until all Floridians unemployed from #COVID19 are receiving the benefits guaranteed to them by CARES Act. https://t.co/74nT5Kshj8

Tunisia of Clearwater was receiving unemployment until it unexpectedly stopped. This forced Tunisia’s husband a cancer survivor to go to work w/ reduced hours despite his high-risk to #COVID19. If they don't receive their checks they could be evicted. #FloridaEvictionStories https://t.co/ohTmrPVKgE

#NeverForget the over 100000 American lives lost to #COVID19. We must continue to take measures to protect ourselves and others and put an end to this virus in their honor. #DayOfMourning https://t.co/WbODx0Xxra

Sent bipartisan letter calling for protection of Sunshine State tourism economy & jobs. GSA stabilizing rates will help states like ours bounce back post #COVID19 quicker so business pleasure & government travelers can enjoy all Florida has to offer. https://t.co/AppdYjIPoQ https://t.co/Us7hEdxUHr

If you have recovered from #COVID19 you may be the difference for someone fighting for their life against this disease. Please consider donating plasma to help in the fight against Coronavirus – find your closest donation location here 👇 https://t.co/EZRIgdVJUa

TONIGHT: I’ll be hosting a live telephone town hall with local leaders at 6:20pm to discuss #COVID19 take questions and provide updates on federal aid.  🔊 Listen in at https://t.co/vzPwvZ7gGM  📞 Call to ask a question at 855-531-1062 https://t.co/VbVA9AmSnx
UPDATE: Pinellas Small Business Grants are still available for small business owners financially impacted by COVID-19. But don’t wait – submissions close June 1. Apply here 👉https://t.co/RQdbVNjFA8

The Defense Production Act would give states lifesaving access to testing PPE and an eventual vaccine to combat #COVID19. The health and well-being of the American people is our top priority also critical to our national defense. https://t.co/ReAGdnrtap https://t.co/oCMHYKjp9v

.@USNationalGuard has played a critical role in slowing and containing the spread of #COVID19 in communities across the country. To end their service just one day shy of being able to qualify for earned benefits is unjust puts the American people at risk. https://t.co/GgEKXHbKBx https://t.co/s777lgvT64

Pinellas artists! Applications have reopened for the Pinellas Arts Community Relief Fund. Grants of $500 for artists or $1500 for organizations or creative businesses are available for those struggling financially as a result of COVID-19. Apply here https://t.co/zAhUGDNDCp

Attention Clearwater! Businesses owners facing financial hardships as a result of COVID-19 can now apply for emergency relief through the Clearwater Back-to-Business Grant and Professional Services Program. Apply here 👇  https://t.co/hbgfni6bAd

Testing is the key to combating the spread of #COVID19 which is why the bill includes another $75B for testing and contact tracing including grants for counties and localities to hire up their local public health workforce 💉

$375 billion in direct aid to counties and mid-sized cities like St. Pete Largo and Clearwater. Local governments are on the frontlines and these funds will keep our police fire EMS responders on the job as we navigate the #COVID19 crisis 🏙️💰

A big thank you to all the Pinellas nurses who joined us tonight to share their experiences on the front lines of the #COVID19 crisis. We’re working on a new aid package in Congress to better protect & provide for our health care heroes. Thank you for your sacrifice God bless!

Tune in tonight at 7:30 pm as I join @WFLA and host @WFLAKeith for a virtual town hall to share the latest #COVID19 updates and what the federal government is doing to lend a helping hand to folks and small biz in need! Viewers are invited to submit questions using #8onyourside. https://t.co/EkHQmvsazH
$1.1 MILLION from @HHSGov for more Coronavirus testing in Pinellas. The more we test the better we can respond to this crisis and re-open safely and efficiently! https://t.co/jaCCPMyh0p

Wonderful news for Florida fisheries as #CARESAct allocates over $23 million to fishery-related businesses negatively impacted by #COVID19. Commercial fishermen charters-for-hire & others can learn more here ➡️ https://t.co/uD0jhfYzQq

UPDATE: @CHCPinellas will open a fourth COVID-19 testing site at their Lealman location starting next week. Testing is by appointment only to protect public safety – if you wish to get tested call 727-824-8181 and select option 0 to schedule an appointment. https://t.co/U2N0HtB0pf

Happy #NationalNursesDay to all the healthcare heroes working long hours to save lives during the #COVID19 pandemic! Nurses are on the front lines of this crisis & I look forward to working with my colleagues to pass hazard pay for healthcare workers in #CARES2! #ThankYouNurses https://t.co/hA5FfNQS4g

Thank you to the physicians & community leaders who joined yesterday’s call on what is needed to keep patients & our community safe from #COVID19. You’re on the front lines - it’s our job to keep you supplied & supported while you fight back this virus.

Pinellas join us today at 12 pm for a virtual town hall with @AlzAdvocacyFL and Department of @ElderAffairs to as we discuss federal and state response to #COVID19. Click here to register https://t.co/EQUtmSdCXB https://t.co/3HzO8Uo8Pi

City of @StPeteFL has opened the Fighting Chance Fund to even more small business owners impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. Learn more below! https://t.co/ujDrbWP8nU

We can’t forget about the climate crisis in the face of #COVID19. Renewable energy tax credits will provide much-needed jobs and move us forward on climate. 🌎   @SEIA @LCVoters @FCVoters @SierraClub

Make no mistake we're at war against coronavirus and it's time to treat front line healthcare workers like it. RT if you agree that pandemic pay for doctors nurses and hospital staff should be tax free + a $100000 death benefit if killed in the line of duty by the virus. 👩‍⚕️👨‍⚕️ https://t.co/i2i4sUFmcz

Kudos to Pinellas and Hillsborough for making Coronavirus testing available for those in underserved communities! South St. Pete residents who are experiencing symptoms can get tested at Bartlett Park this Saturday from 8am-12pm more info below.  https://t.co/t4eUiOKZ6e

NEWS FOR HOMEOWNERS: The CARES Act gives homeowners facing financial difficulty because of #COVID19 a 6 month “pause” on your mortgage payments. Now regulators confirm – no matter what your bank or servicer tells you YOU WILL NOT OWE A BALLOON PAYMENT. https://t.co/a6j13D4AR8

Traveled to Washington this morning to vote for #COVID19 aid package providing $310 billion for small biz and $100 billion for hospitals and testing supplies. A lot of work ahead but we’ll never stop fighting #ForThePeople  https://t.co/LRMOM32RsX https://t.co/NgPyW6wXe3

During the #COVID19 crisis the work of @USPS is more critical than ever. Thank you to all of our postal workers for looking out #ForthePeople! https://t.co/od7xqdUMIL

The @WWP is giving $10 million to help meet immediate needs of veterans in urgent and significant financial crisis due to #COVID19. Learn more below 👇 https://t.co/MEtqvQtT7E

Answering your #COVID19 questions with Mayor @Kriseman @MyClearwater Mayor Hibbard and @BayCare CMO Dr. Anand. Thanks for tuning in and staying informed! https://t.co/R2pKRBEBpy

TONIGHT: I’ll be hosting a live telephone town hall at 6:30pm to discuss #COVID19 and the aid that’s on the way.  🔊  Listen in at https://t.co/vzPwvZoRyk  📞  Call to ask a question at 855-531-1062 https://t.co/BHLmVGhaCl

PINELLAS: Join me Monday April 13th at 6:30pm for a telephone town hall on #COVID19. We’ll be taking questions on the health and economic impacts and assistance available to individuals and small businesses. Tune in at https://t.co/vzPwvZ7gGM https://t.co/h2pZc8aSHE

FRONT LINE HEALTH CARE WORKERS: If you or someone you know is a medical professional or first responder on front lines of #COVID19 & in need of place to stay - @Airbnb has launched #FrontlineStays waiving all fees to book with them. Learn more and apply at https://t.co/R1IXKwfD07

Faith based organizations that would meet 501(c)3 requirements including houses of worship like churches and temples are eligible for #COVID19 relief loans from @SBAgov. Learn more about aid that’s available and how you can apply here https://t.co/fubWmnAKB4

Our nurses and midwives are on the front lines of the #COVID19 crisis. America owes them a debt of gratitude and the best way to start paying back their sacrifice is to follow @CDCgov guidelines to help #flattenthecurve. #WorldHealthDay https://t.co/Vao00BXXhm
Kudos to @USFHealth @NorthwellHealth and @FormLabs for working together to design and mass produce 3D printed #COVID19 tests for the people of Tampa Bay. #GoBulls 💛💚https://t.co/vrvBNojZMF

STARTING SOON: Joining @jenniferwebbfl for a town hall on the coronavirus crisis and what state and federal government are doing to help. Tune in LIVE at five to ask your questions! https://t.co/RALBqNvBLO https://t.co/L9ebMQIOsy

Thank you to the dedicated retail and grocery workers working selflessly to help their neighbors during the #COVID19 pandemic. We must continue to fight for fair pay and paid sick leave for workers during this crisis and beyond! https://t.co/9qcWoFXlLf
